items.q: A traditional Hawaiian feast is called ____. a. an imu b. a lei c. a luau d. a muumuu
After Hawaiians dig a hole for the underground imu oven, they ____ the bottom of the hole with lava rocks. a. push b. line c. burn d. cook
When Hawaiians prepare for a fire in the underground imu oven, firewood is ____ the night before. a. lit b. patted down c. piled up d. accommodated
For Hawaiian Thanksgiving, a canvas covering is put into the underground imu oven, then dirt is ____ into the hole. a. shoveled b. burned c. bundled d. pasted
While the Thanksgiving food is cooking, Hawaiians can enjoy the wonderful smell that ____ from the oven. a. piles up b. emerges c. consoles d. frustrates
The ____ Hawaiian dress is called a muumuu . a. tradition b. traditionally c. traditional d. traditions
The thesis statement is usually the ____ sentence in the introduction. a. first b. second c. third d. last
The actual Calaveras Jumping Frog Contest was ____ by Mark Twain's story called "The Calaveras Jumping Frog Contest." a. inspiration b. inspired c. inspires d. inspiring
One problem with using frogs in a competition is that the frog's behavior is ____. a. predictable b. unpredictable c. predicts d. unpredicting
You can go to Croaker College to teach your frog the basics, or ____, of frog jumping. a. auctions b. frustrations c. consolations d. fundamentals
When you ____ the Jumping Frog Contest, you must pay a small fee. a. entrance b. enter c. enters d. entrants
If you start the first word of a paragraph with the word first , what word should begin the next paragraph? a. next b. before c. after d. finally

Which sentence is not a general statement? a. Most American families celebrate Thanksgiving. b. Some people like chicken better than turkey. c. Many people don't like chicken. d. Our Thanksgiving turkey cost $8.95.

Which sentence is not a thesis statement? a. Many unusual holidays are celebrated in South America. b. National holidays help create unity inside a country. c. Americans celebrate Independence Day in many ways. d. Bastille Day is celebrated on July 14 in France.
The people who don't win the Calaveras Jumping Frog Contest have the ____ of knowing that they can try again next year. a. frustration b. accommodation c. consolation d. incitement
The children _____ pictures of pumpkins on their Halloween poster. a. celebrated b. cut c. pasted d. tied
While we were away, the newspapers _____ in front of our house. a. grew b. piled up c. read d. emerged
Please tie those newspapers in small _____. a. rocks b. pieces c. bundles d. places
In spring, the flowers _____ from under the snow. a. emerge b. disappear c. move d. close
The cat ate all the food. She didn’t leave a _____. a. lot b. trace c. dish d. fish
Please answer the questions very _____. a. care b. caring c. careful d. carefully
Different countries have different Thanksgiving _____. a. traditional b. traditions c. traditionally d. tradition
How does your family _____ birthdays? a. celebrate b. celebrating c. celebration d. celebrations
My friends tried to _____ me to fight with the school bully. a. have b. show c. incite d. allow
A job as a volunteer in a hospital _____ a career as a doctor. a. can be the launching pad for b. is unrelated to c. usually happens at the end of d. requires more education than
You can suggest your own price at _____. a. a department store b. an auction c. a supermarket d. a store
My older brother encouraged me a lot. He was an important _____. a. graduate b. enemy c. inspiration d. description
The ice cream cone I had after losing the game was my only _____. a. inspiration b. consolation c. take-off point d. invitation
The weather changes all the time. It’s _____. a. steady b. unpredictable c. boring d. regular
After failing my driver’s test three times, I’m really _____. a. incited b. inspired c. frustrated d. consoled
I plan to enter the next _____. a. compete b. competes c. competition d. competitive
I am generally correct in my _____. a. predicted b. predictions c. predictable d. predictably
The Hawaiian feast, or luau, is a new tradition.
Hawaiians celebrate Thanksgiving by roasting a chicken in an underground imu oven.
During Hawaiian Thanksgiving, dirt is shoveled over the hole of the imu and then patted down.
The first statement in an essay introduction should be very specific.
Chronological order means the time order that events happened.
Hawaiians celebrate all their holidays just like the other U.S. states.
A conclusion may restate the thesis statement in different words.
The Calaveras Jumping Frog Contest happens two times a year.
In the Calaveras Jumping Frog Competition, each frog must jump five times.
The conclusion always gives more supporting information about the essay topic.
In Hawaii, the Thanksgiving turkey cooks for three or four hours.
The conclusion of an essay contains detailed information.
The conclusion is the final paragraph of an essay.
The jumping frog competition takes place in California.
More than 50,000 people attend the Calaveras Jumping Frog Contest each year.
Most entrants in the Calaveras Jumping Frog Contest are from the United States.
Entrants must pay money to compete in the jumping frog contest.

INSTRUCTIONS: Write a conclusion for an essay with the introduction. American culture has both formal and informal way of addressing people. In informal situations, Americans are often addressed by their first names. However in more formal situations, like speaking to your boss or your child's teacher, most Americans are addressed by their last name and the title Mr., Mrs., or Ms. It's not easy to know when to use a first name or a last name, so the cultural rules for addressing people in America are very confusing for a newcomer.
